definition: see 謎兒|谜儿[mei4 r5], riddle
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: But the mystique that surrounded the terrorist chieftain in life is persisting in death.
sentences.chinese: 但是圍繞這位恐怖主義首領一生的謎團卻並未解開。

sentences.english: We are pleased to have resolved this longstanding puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 我們很高興能解開這個長期存在的謎團。

sentences.english: The story of online grocer FreshDirect is something of a chicken-or-egg riddle.
sentences.chinese: 網上食雜商新鮮直達的故事有點像雞與蛋的謎團。

sentences.english: Placebos are still a scientific mystery.
sentences.chinese: 安慰劑仍然是科學謎團。

sentences.english: However, nobody knows. That's why I think, just let the mystery be.
sentences.chinese: 但是無人知曉，我想還是讓這個謎團隨它去吧。

sentences.english: Efforts to piece together the H. floresiensis puzzle will proceed, however.
sentences.chinese: 不過，解開弗洛瑞斯人謎團的研究工作會繼續下去。

sentences.english: Still, what about the mystery that started our exploration?
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，那麼我們開始探索時的那個謎團呢？

sentences.english: The city of Atlantis remains a mystery.
sentences.chinese: 亞特蘭提斯城仍舊是一個謎團。

sentences.english: He believes that laws can cover the fathomless mysteries of human behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他堅信法律會覆蓋掉人類行爲上那些深不可測的謎團。

sentences.english: The true mystery about the tablet lies in its software and user interface.
sentences.chinese: 真正的謎團在於平板電腦的軟件和用戶界面。

sentences.english: There are still many ancient mysteries that archeologists are looking into and trying to figure out.
sentences.chinese: 有許多古老謎團尚待考古學家來調查並試圖解開。

sentences.english: A second puzzle is why the effect has not been arbitraged away.
sentences.chinese: 第二個謎團是爲什麼該效應沒有因爲套利而消失。

sentences.english: The popularity of Jack Black is one of the mysteries of Hollywood.
sentences.chinese: 積柏克受人歡迎是荷里活其中一個謎團。

sentences.english: Yet another longstanding mystery is why Mercury has a magnetic field.
sentences.chinese: 另一個懸而未決的謎團是爲什麼水星上有磁場。

sentences.english: There are enigmas in identification, even for Freud himself.
sentences.chinese: 認同的謎團重重，即使是對於佛洛伊德本人。

sentences.english: That is one of the great mysteries.
sentences.chinese: 這是最難解的謎團之一。

definition: covered in dust/dusty/lying unused for a long time
foreshadowing (literary device)/foretaste of material to come (in essay or story)
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
